title: Understanding PivotTable Functions
text: In a PivotTable, you can summarize data using different functions like SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT, etc. Switching between these functions can help you analyze your data in various ways.

title: Accessing the Shortcut Menu
text: To change the summary function in a PivotTable, you need to access the shortcut menu. This menu provides options to modify how your data is summarized.

hintAnswer: $$right-click$$ the cell to display the shortcut menu
title: Using the Shortcut Menu
text: What action should you take to access the shortcut menu in a PivotTable?
choices: $$right-click$$ the cell to display the shortcut menu
$$double-click$$ the cell to open the menu
hover over the cell to see options
click the cell to select it

hintAnswer: switch the function on 'Summarize Values By'
title: Switching the Summary Function
text: Once you have accessed the shortcut menu, how do you switch the summary function?
choices: switch the function on 'Summarize Values By'
click AVERAGE on the 'Summarize Values By'
drag the Service Type button across the region you plan to change the summary functions of
